Description: Fragment of oval handle to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 131 BC (probably; see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Nikasagoras. More likely to be Nikasagoras III than II.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (199)
